techmeme.title: Messari CEO Ryan Selkis says he's stepping down, after a series of controversial political X posts; chief revenue officer Eric Turner will be the interim CEO (Brady Dale/Axios)
The outage appears to have been caused by CrowdStrike pushing a faulty update to its Falcon software that causes Windows machines to get stuck in a boot loop (Emma Roth/The Verge)
Samsung says it has "temporarily" stopped deliveries of Galaxy Buds 3 Pro to retailers after some early owners reported quality control issues with the ear tips (Hadlee Simons/Android Authority)
Experts say CrowdStrike's fix requires tampering with system files with no way to automate it at scale, meaning outages could persist for longer than expected (New York Times)
CrowdStrike and other endpoint security tools need access to the core of operating systems, giving them the ability to disrupt systems they're trying to protect (Bloomberg)
